intro: Arabis undulata, commonly known as the wavy rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine environments. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal, rosette-like, and have a wavy or undulating edge, giving it its common name.
